data.title: Great Ribs
data.text: I am not big on buffets but I wanted endless crab legs. I thought I would eat pounds, but I didn't. The only other item I ate were ribs. The ribs were some of the best flavored and fall of the bone tender. The cost was $30. Included is 2 glasses of beer or wine.

data.title: The best buffet in Shreveport
data.text: We went on a Monday night and they had both boiled, fried shrimp and crab legs. They had so many desert choices.

data.title: Breakfast was good but  pricey
data.text: IMO breakfast should be included with room, but it's a casino I understand. $10 is a little much for the basics

data.title: Wine, Wine and more Wine!!!!
data.text: me and my girlfriends had dinner here on a Friday night and they had everything for everybody. I picked this place and my friends are glad i did. It was a lot of us and we were all pleased with our meal. I enoyed the prime rib and mashed potatoes, my girlfriends enjoyed the crab legs, and the made to order pasta. Our waitress made sure the wine kept coming. This place was a hit.

data.title: Good Place to eat
data.text: I've only eaten lunch meal but I wished if casino issue free meal coupon it could be used for lunch or supper.Also I feel if you show coupon and I'd you shouldn't have to show playing card. Food good not enough choices but good enough to visit again.

data.title: Excellent quality
data.text: I felt it was a bit pricey, over $25., but then I am told this is the normal price for buffets in casinos now. Reluctantly I paid the fee and was not disappointed. The food quality was very good & so very much to choose from.

data.title: Disappointing Although a MUST for any Seafood Lover
data.text: They offer a buffet with international cuisine, this month is Spain. They had a few interesting dishes there which I did try, they were a little too salty but not bad. There is a station for sea food where they serve crab legs, fresh mussels, clams for example. Another station for Asian cuisine which I looked at and thought it was very boring, just 4 types of dishes that to me did not look very appetizing and I love Asian food. The last station offers traditional American comfort food, ribs, meat loaf, mash potatoes, Roast Turkey, beef freshly sliced. Of course then there is the salad station with the generic stuff that most buffets have. I asked for some turkey and was given only ONE slice I had nothing else on my plate I was pretty disappointed. Even the sweet station really did not appeal to me, maybe I just wasnt in the mood. I did expect a little more really especially for the price at $26.99 per head which does include a soft drink. I didnt like the way that most people paid a tip upfront even before you sat down, I assume this is because you pay as you enter. The waitress was then taking the money out of the till and giving it to a member of staff which to me looked very dodgy. I would give this a miss next time I visit to me it really was not worth the money if your not into the seafood, which is really the wow factor for this restaurant.
